summary: This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List, generated on April 6, 2021, detailing 22 travel records for an individual from 1997 to 2016. The document shows international flights primarily between the United States (LAX, JFK, RDU) and the United Kingdom (LHR, LGW), with entries noting APIS (Advance Passenger Information System) status and inspection details. It is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case materials.

persons.name: Kimberly Meder
persons.context: Listed as the person who generated this TECS Person Encounter List on April 6, 2021.

events.title: Earliest Recorded Flight
events.description: First travel entry in the TECS list, involving an airline (VS) with a document check at JFK Airport.

events.title: Most Recent Recorded Flight
events.description: Latest travel entry in the list, a flight from LAX to LHR with APIS status 'NOT ON' and an inspection type of 'BOARD'.

keyFacts: The document is a confidential law enforcement travel history (TECS list) containing 22 entries for an individual spanning from 1997 to 2016.

The travel pattern shows frequent flights between the U.S. (primarily LAX and JFK) and the UK (LHR and LGW), with airlines including Virgin Atlantic (VS), British Airways (BA), United (UA), and American (AA).
Many entries include APIS (Advance Passenger Information System) status, with notes like 'ON BOARD', 'PASSENGER', or 'NOT ON', and inspection types such as 'BOARD'.

The document is marked 'For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive' and 'CONFIDENTIAL', with identifiers linking it to the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case against Ghislaine Maxwell (SDNY_GM_02753142/3).
The primary subject of the travel list is not named in the provided text; the entries are detailed but the individual's name appears to be redacted or omitted from this excerpt.
